trans-unit.source: Controls access to network information and traffic statistics for the local computer.
This class cannot be inherited.
This permission is used to secure data returned by the classes in the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation> namespace.
For declarative security, use the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationPermissionAttribute> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationPermission"></xref> class using the specified <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationAccess"></xref> value.
The permission created by this constructor can be used to secure access to network information.
One of the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationAccess"></xref> values.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationPermission"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState"></xref>.
The permission created by this constructor can be used to secure access to network information.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState"></xref> values.
Gets the level of access to network information controlled by this permission.

A <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationPermission> created with <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState?displayProperty=fullName> is given <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationAccess.Ping> | <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationAccess.Read> access.

A <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationPermission> created with <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState?displayProperty=fullName> is given <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationAccess.None> access.
One of the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationAccess"></xref> values.
Adds the specified value to this permission.
Use this method to modify access to network information by adding to the state of the current permission.
One of the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationAccess"></xref> values.
Creates and returns an identical copy of this permission.
A copy of a permission represents the same access to resources as the original permission.
A <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationPermission"></xref> that is identical to the current permission
Sets the state of this permission using the specified XML encoding.
This method is used by the security system and is not normally called by application code.
A <xref href="System.Security.SecurityElement"></xref> that contains the XML encoding to use to set the state of the current permission
securityElement is `null`.
securityElement is not a permission encoding.
-or-
securityElement is not an encoding of a .
-or-
securityElement has invalid values.
Creates and returns a permission that is the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.
The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the state they both describe in common.
Only a demand that passes both original permissions will pass the intersection.
An <xref href="System.Security.IPermission"></xref> to intersect with the current permission.
It must be of the same type as the current permission.
A <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationPermission"></xref> that represents the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.
This new permission is `null` if the intersection is empty or target is `null`.
target is not a .
Determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.
The current permission is a subset of the specified permission if the current permission specifies a state that is wholly contained by the specified permission.
If this method returns true, the current permission represents no more access to the protected resource than does the specified permission.
An <xref href="System.Security.IPermission"></xref> that is to be tested for the subset relationship.
This permission must be of the same type as the current permission
`true` if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value indicating whether the current permission is unrestricted.
An unrestricted permission is created using the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationPermission.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
`true` if the current permission is unrestricted; otherwise, `false`.
Creates an XML encoding of the state of this permission.
This method is used by the security system and is not normally called by application code.
A <xref href="System.Security.SecurityElement"></xref> that contains the XML encoding of the current permission.
Creates a permission that is the union of this permission and the specified permission.

The <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationPermission.Union%2A> method returns a permission that represents all the states represented by both the current permission and the specified permission.
Any demand that passes either permission passes their union.
A <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationPermission"></xref> permission to combine with the current permission.
A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
